titles.title: Corporate Executives' Stock Option Accountability Act
A bill to require that stock option compensation paid to corporate executives be recorded as a compensation expense in corporate financial statements.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S914-915)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: 1/28/1993--Introduced. Corporate Executives' Stock Option Accountability Act - Amends the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to direct the Securities and Exchange Commission to require the issuer of stock options to identify as an expense in its financial statements the fair value of options granted to its senior corporate personnel in exchange for services.
